article_title: Longtime Walker aide Cullen Werwie leaving administration
article_text:
MADISON, Wis. (AP) - One of the last members of Gov. Scott Walker’s administration who has been with him since first taking office in 2011 is leaving for the private sector.

Former Walker spokesman and current Department of Administration communications director Cullen Werwie said Monday he is leaving his post in January. Werwie says he plans to find a job in the private sector.

Werwie worked on Walker’s 2010 campaign, served on his transition team and was his spokesman until April 2013 when he took his current job in DOA.

Werwie received immunity for his testimony in a John Doe investigation into Walker’s former aides and associates in Milwaukee County. That probe led to charges against six people.

Walker this year signed a bill doing away with John Doe probes for political misconduct.

Scott Walker’s administration who has been with him since first taking office in 2011 is leaving for the private sector.
Walker this year signed a bill doing away with John Doe probes for political misconduct.
Werwie received immunity for his testimony in a John Doe investigation into Walker’s former aides and associates in Milwaukee County.
Werwie worked on Walker’s 2010 campaign, served on his transition team and was his spokesman until April 2013 when he took his current job in DOA.
